text: The wellbeing of children
and safeguarding of children
is so important to us.
It’s at the heart of everything that we do,
so we meet the UK’s highest standards
around child protection and safeguarding.
And that’s both in our schools,
but also online as well.
Parents can expect that
every child receives individualised attention
and that the teachers plan the lessons
according to each child’s needs.
Parents are very important to us.
We see them as partners in the learning experience.
So parents will come to pick up their children.
We can give them very informal,
very quick feedback on how [their child] has done
in that particular class.
Quite often parents will ask us
maybe if there’s anything else they can do
to improve their child’s speaking or vocabulary
and we will give suggestions.
Once children have completed Learning Time with Timmy,
the next programme is Primary Plus
which is for primary learners.
It continues the ethos of Learning Time with Timmy;
engagement, play and fun,
but brings in life skills
and other areas more appropriate for primary.
